member.name: IShellItemArray.BindToHandler
member.summary: Binds to an object by means of the specified handler.
member.param: A pointer to an interface on a bind context object.

param.name: bhid
param.para: One of the following values, defined in Shlguid.h, that determine the handler.
Restricts usage to . Use this handler type only for a flat item array, where all items are in the same folder.
Introduced in Windows Vista: Gets an object for use with an item or an array of items. Use this handler type only for flat data objects or item arrays created by .
Introduced in Windows Vista: Gets an object for use with an item or an array of items. This only retrieves the association array object for the first item in the

member.param: The IID of the object type to retrieve.
When this methods returns, contains the object specified in riid that is returned by the handler specified by rbhid.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IShellItemArray.EnumItems
member.summary: Gets an enumerator of the items in the array.
member.param: When this method returns, contains an pointer that enumerates the that are in the array.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IShellItemArray.GetAttributes
member.summary: Gets the attributes of the set of items contained in an . If the array contains more than one item, the attributes retrieved by this method are not the attributes of single items, but a logical combination of all of the requested attributes of all of the items.

param.name: AttribFlags
param.para: If the array contains a single item, this method provides the same results as . However, if the array contains multiple items, the attribute sets of all the items are combined into a single attribute set and returned in the value pointed to by psfgaoAttribs. This parameter takes one of the following values to define how that final attribute set is determined:

0x00000001. If there are multiple items in the array, use a bitwise AND to combine the attributes across items. For instance, if the array contains two items where one item can be moved (SFGAO_CANMOVE) and a second item cannot, the method returns (1 & 0) or 0 for that attribute bit.

0x00000002. If there are multiple items in the array, use a bitwise OR to combine the attributes across items. For instance, if the array contains two items where one item can be moved (SFGAO_CANMOVE) and a second item cannot, the method returns (1 | 0) or 1 for that attribute bit.

0x00000003. Retrieve the attributes directly from the Shell data source. To use this value, the Shell item array must have been initialized as an with its contents specified as an array of child PIDLs.
0x00000003. A mask for SIATTRIBFLAGS_AND, SIATTRIBFLAGS_OR, and SIATTRIBFLAGS_APPCOMPAT. Callers normally do not use this value.

0x00004000. Windows 7 and later. Examine all items in the array to compute the attributes. Note that this can result in poor performance over large arrays and therefore it should be used only when needed. Cases in which you pass this flag should be extremely rare. See Remarks for more details.

member.param: A mask that specifies what particular attributes are being requested. A bitwise OR of one or more of the SFGAO values.
A bitmap that, when this method returns successfully, contains the values of the requested attributes.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the attributes returned exactly match those requested in sfgaoMask, S_FALSE if the attributes do not exactly match, or a standard COM error value otherwise.

member.name: IShellItemArray.GetCount
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the given array.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the number of items in the .
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.summary: Gets the item at the given index in the .
member.param: The index of the requested in the
When this method returns, contains the requested pointer.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.param: A reference to the structure specifying which property list to retrieve.
The IID of the object type to retrieve.
When this method returns, contains the interface requested in riid. This will typically be .
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

When this method returns, contains interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically or .

member.name: IShellItemArray
member.summary: Exposes methods that create and manipulate arrays.
